value.text: Aang, Katara, Sokka, Toph, Hakoda, Haru, Jet, Teo, Bato, Pipsqueak, Freedom Fighters, more ...
value.value_text: Aang, Katara, Sokka, Toph, Hakoda, Haru, Jet, Teo, Bato, Pipsqueak, Freedom Fighters, more ...

paragraphs.body: The Duke was an ${link_0} boy, who, at the age of eight, was the youngest and smallest of the ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: The Duke was an Earth Kingdom boy, who, at the age of eight, was the youngest and smallest of the Freedom Fighters.

paragraphs.body: The Duke fought ${link_0} ${link_1} who were encamped near the ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: The Duke fought Fire Nation soldiers who were encamped near the treetop hideout.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} and the other Freedom Fighters came across The Duke when they caught him trying to steal ${link_1} from their ${link_2}. According to Jet, The Duke never had a home.
paragraphs.text: Jet and the other Freedom Fighters came across The Duke when they caught him trying to steal food from their camp. According to Jet, The Duke never had a home.

paragraphs.body: Being a constant companion to ${link_0}, the duo originally appeared as guerrilla fighters, assisting Jet in the fight against the ${link_1} occupation of ${link_2}. When ${link_3}, ${link_4}, and ${link_5} were cornered by a company of Fire Nation soldiers, The Duke and the other Freedom Fighters came to the rescue. During the ensuing battle, The Duke dropped out of a tree, right on the helmet of one of the soldiers and rode him "like a wild ${link_6}". When Jet introduced his Freedom Fighters to ${link_7} after the battle, Aang mistook The Duke for being Pipsqueak. After snooping through the camp's supplies, The Duke and Pipsqueak found barrels full of ${link_8} and boxes filled with jelly candy. The Freedom Fighters loaded up the loot in a cart and headed back to their hideout, where they had a feast to celebrate their victory over the Fire Nation soldiers.
paragraphs.text: Being a constant companion to Pipsqueak, the duo originally appeared as guerrilla fighters, assisting Jet in the fight against the Fire Nation occupation of Gaipan. When Aang, Katara, and Sokka were cornered by a company of Fire Nation soldiers, The Duke and the other Freedom Fighters came to the rescue. During the ensuing battle, The Duke dropped out of a tree, right on the helmet of one of the soldiers and rode him "like a wild hog monkey". When Jet introduced his Freedom Fighters to Team Avatar after the battle, Aang mistook The Duke for being Pipsqueak. After snooping through the camp's supplies, The Duke and Pipsqueak found barrels full of blasting jelly and boxes filled with jelly candy. The Freedom Fighters loaded up the loot in a cart and headed back to their hideout, where they had a feast to celebrate their victory over the Fire Nation soldiers.

paragraphs.body: A few days later, The Duke was among the Freedom Fighters who headed out at night with a cart filled with barrels of blasting jelly. When Jet was explaining his plan to blow up the dam with the jelly and subsequently flood Gaipan and everyone living there, The Duke voiced concern for the people, something Jet countered by stating that it was "the price of ridding this area of the Fire Nation". The Duke proceeded to help ${link_0} and some other Freedom Fighters to place the barrels full of explosives at the base of the dam.
paragraphs.text: A few days later, The Duke was among the Freedom Fighters who headed out at night with a cart filled with barrels of blasting jelly. When Jet was explaining his plan to blow up the dam with the jelly and subsequently flood Gaipan and everyone living there, The Duke voiced concern for the people, something Jet countered by stating that it was "the price of ridding this area of the Fire Nation". The Duke proceeded to help Sneers and some other Freedom Fighters to place the barrels full of explosives at the base of the dam.

paragraphs.body: After Jet destroyed Gaipan with a flood intending to kill every inhabitant, Pipsqueak and The Duke lost faith in their once idolized leader and parted ways with the Freedom Fighters. They traveled throughout the Earth Kingdom, stealing to eat and struggling to survive. The two eventually came across ${link_0}'s ship one night and attempted to raid it, but were caught in the act and captured. After hearing their story, Sokka and Katara welcomed Pipsqueak and The Duke to join their makeshift invasion force. During their time at ${link_1}, they were described as "surprisingly helpful" when they were not getting into trouble.
paragraphs.text: After Jet destroyed Gaipan with a flood intending to kill every inhabitant, Pipsqueak and The Duke lost faith in their once idolized leader and parted ways with the Freedom Fighters. They traveled throughout the Earth Kingdom, stealing to eat and struggling to survive. The two eventually came across Hakoda's ship one night and attempted to raid it, but were caught in the act and captured. After hearing their story, Sokka and Katara welcomed Pipsqueak and The Duke to join their makeshift invasion force. During their time at Chameleon Bay, they were described as "surprisingly helpful" when they were not getting into trouble.

paragraphs.body: The Duke was a member of the ${link_0} force.
paragraphs.text: The Duke was a member of the invasion force.

paragraphs.body: The Duke and Pipsqueak returned with Hakoda and the others the day of the ${link_0}, ready to do their part in the ${link_1}. The Duke easily got along with ${link_2}, even offering her his helmet when she got seasick traveling in a ${link_3}. However, the invasion failed, and with the destruction of the submarines, the warriors decided to surrender. The Duke parted with Pipsqueak when the young boy was among those who made their escape atop ${link_4}, along with Aang, Katara, Sokka, ${link_5}, and ${link_6}.
paragraphs.text: The Duke and Pipsqueak returned with Hakoda and the others the day of the Day of Black Sun, ready to do their part in the invasion of the Fire Nation. The Duke easily got along with Toph, even offering her his helmet when she got seasick traveling in a waterbending-powered submarine. However, the invasion failed, and with the destruction of the submarines, the warriors decided to surrender. The Duke parted with Pipsqueak when the young boy was among those who made their escape atop Appa, along with Aang, Katara, Sokka, Teo, and Haru.

paragraphs.body: The Duke was temporarily part of Team Avatar when they occupied the ${link_0} after their defeat during the invasion. There, The Duke, Haru, and Teo explored the temple's many secrets together, during which the other two often referred to him incorrectly as just "Duke". While at the temple, The Duke bonded with Teo and Haru, spectating with them during a "swordbending" duel and joining the group's nonbenders in the "Bendless Boomerang Club". When ${link_1} attacked the Western Air Temple under ${link_2} ${link_3}'s command, the gang was forced to abandon the site. The Duke, Teo, Haru, Hakoda, and ${link_4} separated from Aang's group and fled the temple on a previously stolen airship.
paragraphs.text: The Duke was temporarily part of Team Avatar when they occupied the Western Air Temple after their defeat during the invasion. There, The Duke, Haru, and Teo explored the temple's many secrets together, during which the other two often referred to him incorrectly as just "Duke". While at the temple, The Duke bonded with Teo and Haru, spectating with them during a "swordbending" duel and joining the group's nonbenders in the "Bendless Boomerang Club". When Fire Nation airships attacked the Western Air Temple under Princess Azula's command, the gang was forced to abandon the site. The Duke, Teo, Haru, Hakoda, and Chit Sang separated from Aang's group and fled the temple on a previously stolen airship.

paragraphs.body: After the ${link_0} ended, The Duke returned to the Fire Nation for ${link_1}'s coronation as the new ${link_2}. There, he reunited with Pipsqueak and hugged Toph.
paragraphs.text: After the Hundred Year War ended, The Duke returned to the Fire Nation for Zuko's coronation as the new Fire Lord. There, he reunited with Pipsqueak and hugged Toph.
